reference.title: euare-usergetattributes
reference.shortdesc: Returns Amazon resource name (ARN) and user ID for a user.

row.entry: Name of the user whose attributes you want to get. If you don't specify this parameter, it defaults to the user making the request.

entry.draft-comment: This was on Mitch's output for me, but not in the original man page. Do we have more info about this?

section.title: Output
section.p: When you use the -u option to specify a user, Eucalyptus returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and user ID for that user. When you don't specify a user, Eucalyptus returns the ARN and the AWS account ID of the user making the request.
